intro: Hoffmannia haydenii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Hoffmannia haydenii is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats.
